#Text=Ontario Votes 2007 : Interview with Family Coalition Party candidate Bill McMaster , Lambton — Kent — Middlesex
#Text=Wednesday , September 26 , 2007
#Text=is running for the Family Coalition Party in the Ontario provincial election , in the Lambton — Kent — Middlesex riding .
#Text=Wikinews ' Nick Moreau interviewed him regarding his values , his experience , and his campaign .
#Text=Stay tuned for further interviews ; every candidate from every party is eligible , and will be contacted .

#Text=Expect interviews from Liberals , Progressive Conservatives , New Democratic Party members , Ontario Greens , as well as members from the Family Coalition , Freedom , Communist , Libertarian , and Confederation of Regions parties , as well as independents .
#Text=Interview
#Text=Why have you chosen to involve yourself in the political process ?
#Text=Partly because I have always been interested in to politics of the country , and because I do not believe in the Progressive Conservatives School funding program .
#Text=I felt that as a conservative , I could not support it .
#Text=The Family Coalition Party best represents my political views at this time .
#Text=Why did you choose to run in this constituency ?
#Text=I live in the riding .
#Text=What prior political experience do you have ?
#Text=Limited .
#Text=Church politics , local hockey politics
#Text=What skills and insight can you bring to office , from other non-political positions you may have held ?
#Text=I am not afraid to ask the hard questions or challenge a position even if it causes controversy
#Text=Which of your competitors do you expect to pose the biggest challenge to your candidacy ?
#Text=Why ?
#Text=The conservative or the liberal .
#Text=The conservative because he IS one of the good guys , although he has to follow the agenda of the leader , and the liberal because she is the incumbent .
#Text=What makes you the most desirable of all candidates running in the riding ?
#Text=I am the only candidate willing to speak openly against abortion and the marriage issues .
#Text=What do you feel are the three most important issues to voters in your riding ?
#Text=Health care , education , and farming .
#Text=Are these the same top three issues that are most important to you ?
#Text=Yes .
#Text=What would you do to address these issues ?
#Text=The Family Coalition Party has a platform for Health and Education .
#Text=Has started a platform for farming , but believes that farmers voices are needed , not just politicos .
#Text=What should be the first order of business in the 39th Legislative Assembly ?
#Text=Cut taxes .
#Text=Are the property taxes in your riding at a fair level for the amount of services received in the municipality ?
#Text=No.
#Text=How can the province lead the way in stimulating job creation ?
#Text=Cut taxes across the board and put more money in peoples pockets .
#Text=What are your views on the mixed member proportional representation ( MMP ) referendum ?
#Text=I 'm unsure , but leaning toward no , only for the reason that I believe there are better ways than the one proposed .
#Text=What role , if any , does “ new media ” play in your campaign , and the campaign of your party ?
#Text=( websites , blogs , Facebook , YouTube videos , etc )
#Text=Do you view it as beneficial , or a challenge ?
#Text=I have a lot of support from www.freedominion.com , a site of principled conservatism .
#Text=Other candidates for the party are also members there , and the owner is running for the Freedom Party .
#Text=The other sites are helpful as far as finding out information , but freedominion is still by far the best source of information , and you are required to provide proof of what you post .
#Text=Of the decisions made by Ontario 's 38th Legislative Assembly , which was the most beneficial to your this electoral district ?
#Text=To the province as a whole ?
#Text=Which was least beneficial , or even harmful , to your this riding ?
#Text=To the province as a whole ?
#Text=Of the decisions made by Ontario 's 38th Legislative Assembly , which was the most beneficial to your this electoral district ?
#Text=To the province as a whole ?
#Text=Which was least beneficial , or even harmful , to your this riding ?
#Text=To the province as a whole ?
#Text=I do n’t know if any were beneficial , I know the health care tax and the largest tax increase in Ontario ’s history was certainly detrimental as it hurt the auto sector in this area .
#Text=Schools have been closed , and hospitals have cut essential staff but created more management .
#Text=As far as anything coming from the liberal camp , I do n’t see much in the way of benefits .
